Change the returned outputs of diyar functions

Source: R/to_s4.R
to_s4.Rd

Convert the returned output of number_line, record_group, episode_group, fixed_episodes and rolling_episodes from a data.frame to number_line, pid or epid objects, and vice versa.

to_s4(df)

to_df(s4)

Arguments

df

data.frame
s4

pid or epid objects

Value

to_s4 - pid or epid objects

to_df - data.frame object

Examples

data(infections)
dates <- infections$date
output <- fixed_episodes(dates, case_length=30)
#> 
#> -------------------------------------                               Tracking episodes; 54% complete.

-------------------------------------------------------------------Tracking episodes; 100% complete.


#> Summary.
#> Time elapsed:   < 0.01 secs
#> Records:
#>   Total:        11
#>   Skipped:      0
#> Episodes:
#>   Total:        2
#>   Single-event: 0
output
#>  [1] "E.1 (C)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.7 (C)"
#>  [8] "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)"

# from the a pid/epid object to a data.frame
df_output <- to_df(output)
df_output
#>    epid sn wind_id wind_nm     case_nm dist_from_wind dist_from_epid iteration
#> 1     1  1       1    Case        Case         0 days         0 days         1
#> 2     1  2       1    Case Duplicate_C         6 days         6 days         1
#> 3     1  3       1    Case Duplicate_C        12 days        12 days         1
#> 4     1  4       1    Case Duplicate_C        18 days        18 days         1
#> 5     1  5       1    Case Duplicate_C        24 days        24 days         1
#> 6     1  6       1    Case Duplicate_C        30 days        30 days         1
#> 7     7  7       7    Case        Case         0 days         0 days         2
#> 8     7  8       7    Case Duplicate_C         6 days         6 days         2
#> 9     7  9       7    Case Duplicate_C        12 days        12 days         2
#> 10    7 10       7    Case Duplicate_C        18 days        18 days         2
#> 11    7 11       7    Case Duplicate_C        24 days        24 days         2

# from a data.frame to pid/epid object
s4_output <- to_s4(df_output)
s4_output
#>  [1] "E.1 (C)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.7 (C)"
#>  [8] "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)"

all(s4_output == output)
#> [1] TRUE
